body.p: The superior vena cava is formed from the joining of __________.

multiple_choice.choice: the left and right jugular veins
the left and right brachiocephalic veins
the two jugular and two brachiocephalic veins
the left and right brachiocephalic veins and the azygos vein

feedback.p: Incorrect. The two jugular veins flow into the brachiocephalic veins.
Correct. The two brachiocephalic veins join together to form the superior vena cava.
Incorrect. The two jugular veins enter the brachiocephalic veins prior to them joining to form the vena cava.
Incorrect. Although the two brachiocephalic veins join to form the superior vena cava, the azygos vein joins the superior vena cava after it has been formed.
